dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, the JEDI contract, right? That whole mess just keeps on giving.

dialogue_turns.text: Oh my goodness, it really does. I mean, we thought Amazon won, and that was that. But no, Microsoft is back at it, and they're, like, going *big*.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amazon on Monday escalated its fierce opposition to Microsoft winning a lucrative government contract... AWS, the e-commerce giants cloud computing division, lost its bid to provide the military with cloud infrastructure to Microsoft in October.

dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, they are! Apparently, they just won some kind of a court victory, and now they're really, uh, pushing the envelope.

dialogue_turns.text: Pushing the envelope is an understatement. They've filed with the U.S. Court of Federal Claims, and they're asking for, get this, depositions from former President Trump, Secretary of Defense Mark Esper, Jim Mattis... even the Chief Information Officer.

dialogue_turns.text: Wait, wait, [interrupts] depositions from Trump? Like, under oath?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And not just that, they want, um, court-ordered discovery. So, like, all the confidential documents, emails, everything related to this $10 billion cloud contract.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And not just that, they want, um, court-ordered discovery. So, like, all the confidential documents, emails, everything related to this ten billion dollar cloud contract.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amazon is also asking for court-ordered discovery, meaning the company wants the Trump administration to hand over documents and emails relating to the contract. Amazon claims it lost the $10 billion contract because Trump is personally biased against CEO Jeff Bezos...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, what's their actual beef here? I thought Amazon won it fair and square, or...?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, what's their actual beef here? I thought Amazon won it fair and square, or...?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, Microsoft's claim, uh, is pretty wild. They're basically saying they *should* have won, but Trump personally interfered because he, you know, despises Jeff Bezos and The Washington Post.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, Microsoft's claim, uh, is pretty wild. They're basically saying they should have won, but Trump personally interfered because he, you know, despises Jeff Bezos and The Washington Post.

dialogue_turns.text: Oh, the "Jeff Bozo" tweet stuff? That's what they're using as evidence?

dialogue_turns.text: Precisely! They're citing those tweets, and, uh, there's a passage from Jim Mattis' speechwriter's book, apparently, where Trump allegedly said he wanted to help Amazon win.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...a passage from an October 2019 book by Mattiss speechwriter, who wrote that Trump said he wanted to screw Amazon out of the contract, as evidence of the presidents intent and hostility toward Amazon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Huh. So, Trump wanted to help Amazon, but Microsoft is saying he prevented *them* from winning because of Bezos. That's a bit of a twist, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huh. So, Trump wanted to help Amazon, but Microsoft is saying he prevented them from winning because of Bezos. That's a bit of a twist, isn't it?

dialogue_turns.text: It is! And remember, when Amazon initially won, *other* companies, like IBM and Oracle, were complaining. They said the Pentagon was biased, but, like, *towards Microsoft*.

IBM and Oracle filed complaints with the Government Accountability Office alleging the Pentagon was biased toward Amazon (both claims were eventually dismissed).

dialogue_turns.text: Right! And Trump even said he'd look into the bidding process back then. So, it's just this whole, um, tangled web of accusations.

dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And then you have Microsoft's spokesperson saying Trump has 'repeatedly demonstrated his unwillingness to use his position... to interfere with government functions.' Which, I mean, [chuckles] that's just dripping with sarcasm, given their whole filing.
